body_html:
@tomrunia You suggestion just works for small datasets, which out-of-core support is not needed. For big dataset, it is not possible to load the entire dataset once, right? If there's is any mistake from my opinion, please let me know.

@tetmin Hi, I have the same issue. And from my search, change hdf5 file to tfrecord or binary file will be the only feasible way. Did you find another way?

body:
@tomrunia  You suggestion just works for small datasets, which out-of-core support is not needed. For big dataset, it is not possible to load the entire dataset once, right? If there's is any mistake from my opinion, please let me know.

@tetmin Hi, I have the same issue. And from my search, change hdf5 file to tfrecord or binary file will be the only feasible way. Did you find another way?
